intro: Stilpnopappus apurensis, commonly known as the Apure thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges. It features a tall, slender stem with grayish-green leaves and produces showy purple to pink flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
